required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Muscle Evaluation of Patients Infected by the Coronavirus
clinical_study.official_title: Muscle Evaluation of Patients Infected by the Coronavirus Requiring Mechanical Ventilation

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) presents risk to develop muscle weakness associated with prolonged period of mechanical ventilation support and hospital stay.

detailed_description.textblock: Intensive care unit (ICU) acquired muscle weakness affects both respiratory and peripheral muscles and can contribute to worsen clinical and functional outcomes. In this way, ultrasonography muscle evaluation could help to identify early alterations guiding the therapeutic planning and allowing to monitor the interventions performed. Therefore, the investigators intend to follow up mechanically ventilated patients with confirmed diagnosis of COVID-19 during ICU stay to quantify the diaphragm, parasternal intercostal, abdominals and femoral quadriceps muscles thickness assessed by ultrasonography. Additionally, functional capacity, frailty and level of physical activity will be evaluated and followed for pre-admission condition and 30, 90 and 180 days after hospital discharge .

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, 5, and within 24 hours after ICU discharge.
primary_outcome.description: Change in the thickness of the diaphragm and quadriceps femoris muscles.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of data collection, within 24 hours after ICU discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the thickness of the intercostal and abdominal wall muscles.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of data collection, within 24 hours after ICU discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Verify the correlation between quadriceps femoris muscle thickness change and echogenicity with functional outcomes (Barthe Index, International Physical Activities Questionnaire, and the Clinical Frailty Score).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of data collection, within 24 hours after ICU discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Verify the correlation between grip strength (measured by the Dynamometer Grip Strength) and clinical outcomes (Barthe Index, International Physical Activities Questionnaire, and the Clinical Frailty Score).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mobility level correlation with clinical and functional outcomes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of data collection, within 24 hours after ICU discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Verify the correlation between mobility level (measured by the Perme Intensive Care Unit Mobility Score) with clinical and functional outcomes (Barthe Index, International Physical Activities Questionnaire, and the Clinical Frailty Score).

intervention.description: Muscle ultrasound evaluation will be performed in patients admitted with COVID-19 requiring invasive mechanical ventilation. The measurements of thickness and thickening fraction will occur for diaphragm, abdominal - rectus abdominis, internal oblique, external oblique and transverse abdomen - and parasternal intercostal muscles. Serial measurements of the thickness and echogenicity of the quadriceps femoris muscle will also be performed.

study_pop.textblock: SARS-CoV-2 patients admitted to the intensive care unit requiring invasive mechanical ventilation.

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data (IPD) collected during the study that underlie results reported will be shared after de-identification (text, tables, figures, and appendices).
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available at the end of the study, as soon as the manuscript became published in a journal (following publication). No end date (data will be available indefinitely).
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Researchers who provide a methodologically sound proposal and/or investigators whose proposed use of the data has been approved by an independent review committee identified for this purpose.
